content.text: I'll create a detailed README.md for the fictional SuperApp project.

input.content:
# SuperApp

A revolutionary all-in-one productivity platform that seamlessly integrates task management, real-time collaboration, and AI-powered insights to supercharge your workflow.

## Table of Contents

- [Overview](#overview)
- [Features](#features)
- [Installation](#installation)
- [Usage](#usage)
- [Architecture](#architecture)
- [API Reference](#api-reference)
- [Contributing](#contributing)
- [License](#license)

## Overview

SuperApp is a comprehensive productivity suite designed for modern teams and individuals who demand more from their tools. Built with cutting-edge technologies including React, Node.js, and GraphQL, SuperApp delivers a lightning-fast, intuitive experience that adapts to your unique workflow.

### Why SuperApp?

- **Unified Experience**: No more switching between multiple apps
- **AI-Powered**: Smart suggestions and automation that learn from your patterns
- **Real-time Sync**: Instant updates across all devices
- **Enterprise-Ready**: Built with security and scalability in mind

## Features

### Core Functionality

- **Smart Task Management**
  - AI-powered task prioritization
  - Natural language task creation
  - Automatic time tracking
  - Custom workflows and templates

- **Real-time Collaboration**
  - Live document editing
  - Video conferencing integration
  - Team chat with threaded conversations
  - Shared workspaces

- **Analytics Dashboard**
  - Personal productivity metrics
  - Team performance insights
  - Custom report generation
  - Goal tracking and forecasting

- **Integration Hub**
  - 50+ native integrations
  - Zapier compatibility
  - REST and GraphQL APIs
  - Webhook support

## Installation

### Prerequisites

- Node.js 18.0 or higher
- PostgreSQL 14+
- Redis 7.0+
- Docker (optional, for containerized deployment)

### Quick Start

```bash
# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/example/superapp.git
cd superapp

# Install dependencies
npm install

# Set up environment variables
cp .env.example .env
# Edit .env with your configuration

# Run database migrations
npm run db:migrate

# Start the development server
npm run dev
```

### Docker Installation

```bash
# Build and start all services
docker-compose up -d

# Access the app at http://localhost:3000
```

### Production Deployment

For production deployments, we recommend using our Kubernetes Helm charts:

```bash
helm repo add superapp https://charts.superapp.io
helm install my-superapp superapp/superapp --values values.yaml
```

## Usage

### Getting Started

1. **Create an Account**: Visit `https://app.superapp.io` and sign up
2. **Set Up Your Workspace**: Choose a workspace name and invite team members
3. **Create Your First Project**: Use the quick start wizard or import existing data
4. **Customize Your Dashboard**: Drag and drop widgets to create your ideal view

### Basic Commands

```bash
# CLI Tool
superapp task create "Review quarterly reports" --due tomorrow
superapp project list
superapp sync --force

# API Examples
curl -X POST https://api.superapp.io/v1/tasks \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY" \
  -d '{"title": "New task", "projectId": "proj_123"}'
```

### Advanced Features

#### Custom Workflows

Create automated workflows using our visual builder or YAML configuration:

```yaml
name: Weekly Review
trigger:
  schedule: "0 9 * * MON"
steps:
  - action: create_task
    params:
      title: "Weekly team review"
      assignee: "@team-lead"
  - action: send_notification
    params:
      channel: "#general"
      message: "Weekly review task created"
```

## Architecture

### System Overview

```
┌─────────────────┐     ┌─────────────────┐     ┌─────────────────┐
│   Web Client    │     │  Mobile Client  │     │   CLI Tool      │
└────────┬────────┘     └────────┬────────┘     └────────┬────────┘
         │                       │                         │
         └───────────────────────┴─────────────────────────┘
                                 │
                        ┌────────▼────────┐
                        │   API Gateway   │
                        │   (GraphQL)     │
                        └────────┬────────┘
                                 │
         ┌───────────────────────┼───────────────────────┐
         │                       │                       │
┌────────▼────────┐     ┌────────▼────────┐    ┌────────▼────────┐
│  Auth Service   │     │  Task Service   │    │Analytics Service│
└─────────────────┘     └─────────────────┘    └─────────────────┘
         │                       │                       │
         └───────────────────────┴───────────────────────┘
                                 │
                        ┌────────▼────────┐
                        │   PostgreSQL    │
                        │   Redis Cache   │
                        └─────────────────┘
```

### Technology Stack

- **Frontend**: React 18, TypeScript, TailwindCSS
- **Backend**: Node.js, Express, GraphQL
- **Database**: PostgreSQL with Prisma ORM
- **Caching**: Redis
- **Message Queue**: RabbitMQ
- **Search**: Elasticsearch
- **Monitoring**: Prometheus + Grafana

## API Reference

### Authentication

All API requests require authentication via Bearer token:

```http
Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY
```

### Endpoints

#### Tasks

```http
GET    /api/v1/tasks          # List all tasks
POST   /api/v1/tasks          # Create a new task
GET    /api/v1/tasks/:id      # Get task details
PUT    /api/v1/tasks/:id      # Update a task
DELETE /api/v1/tasks/:id      # Delete a task
```

#### Projects

```http
GET    /api/v1/projects       # List all projects
POST   /api/v1/projects       # Create a new project
GET    /api/v1/projects/:id   # Get project details
PUT    /api/v1/projects/:id   # Update a project
DELETE /api/v1/projects/:id   # Delete a project
```

### GraphQL Schema

```graphql
type Task {
  id: ID!
  title: String!
  description: String
  status: TaskStatus!
  assignee: User
  project: Project
  createdAt: DateTime!
  updatedAt: DateTime!
}

type Query {
  tasks(filter: TaskFilter, limit: Int, offset: Int): [Task!]!
  task(id: ID!): Task
}

type Mutation {
  createTask(input: CreateTaskInput!): Task!
  updateTask(id: ID!, input: UpdateTaskInput!): Task!
  deleteTask(id: ID!): Boolean!
}
```

## Contributing

We welcome contributions from the community! Please read our [Contributing Guide](CONTRIBUTING.md) for details on our code of conduct and the process for submitting pull requests.

### Development Setup

1. Fork the repository
2. Create your feature branch (`git checkout -b feature/amazing-feature`)
3. Commit your changes (`git commit -m 'Add some amazing feature'`)
4. Push to the branch (`git push origin feature/amazing-feature`)
5. Open a Pull Request

### Code Style

- Follow the [Airbnb JavaScript Style Guide](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript)
- Use Prettier for code formatting
- Write comprehensive tests for new features
- Maintain 90%+ code coverage

## License

This project is licensed under the MIT License - see the [LICENSE](LICENSE) file for details.

---

**SuperApp** - Built with ❤️ by the SuperApp Team

[Website](https://superapp.io) | [Documentation](https://docs.superapp.io) | [Support](https://support.superapp.io)
